qas.question: Boston became one of the wealthiest international ports after what war?
What long held tradition helped make Boston a wealthy port?
Boston was the location of many important events of what war?

context: Many of the crucial events of <a0_0><a2_0>the American Revolution<a2_0/><a0_0/>—the Boston Massacre, the Boston Tea Party, Paul Revere's midnight ride, the battles of Lexington and Concord and Bunker Hill, the Siege of Boston, and many others—occurred in or near Boston. After the Revolution, Boston's long <a1_0>seafaring tradition<a1_0/> helped make it one of the world's wealthiest international ports, with rum, fish, salt, and tobacco being particularly important.
